patience.text: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.
patience.author: John Adams

patience.text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
patience.author: Laozi

patience.text: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
patience.author: Helen Keller

patience.text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
patience.author: Molière

patience.text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
patience.author: Harriet Tubman

patience.text: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
patience.author: Michelle Obama

patience.text: Just be patient. Let the game come to you. Don't rush. Be quick, but don't hurry.
patience.author: Earl Monroe

patience.text: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world.
patience.author: Helen Keller

patience.text: I endeavor to be wise when I cannot be merry, easy when I cannot be glad, content with what cannot be mended and patient when there is no redress.
patience.author: Elizabeth Montagu

patience.text: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
patience.author: A.A. Milne

integrity.text: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
integrity.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

integrity.text: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: Sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
integrity.author: William C. Menninger

integrity.text: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.
integrity.author: Mark Goulston

integrity.text: Be Impeccable with Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
integrity.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

integrity.text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
integrity.author: Sigmund Freud

self-reflection.text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
self-reflection.author: Confucius

self-reflection.text: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.
self-reflection.author: Peter Drucker

self-reflection.text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
self-reflection.author: Anatole France

self-reflection.text: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
self-reflection.author: Susan Orlean

self-reflection.text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
self-reflection.author: Confucius

self-reflection.text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
self-reflection.author: Confucius

self-reflection.text: If you genuinely want something, don't wait for it - teach yourself.
self-reflection.author: Gurbaksh Chahal

self-reflection.text: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
self-reflection.author: Jim Rohn

self-reflection.text: You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb a little himself.
self-reflection.author: Andrew Carnegie

self-reflection.text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
self-reflection.author: Mark Twain

self-reflection.text: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
self-reflection.author: Charles Dickens

self-reflection.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
self-reflection.author: Marcus Aurelius

self-reflection.text: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
self-reflection.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

self-reflection.text: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
self-reflection.author: Charles Spurgeon

empathy.text: Love and compassion open our own inner life, reducing stress, distrust and loneliness.
empathy.author: Dalai Lama

empathy.text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
empathy.author: Confucius

empathy.text: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.
empathy.author: Dalai Lama

empathy.text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
empathy.author: Laozi

empathy.text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
empathy.author: Simone de Beauvoir

empathy.text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
empathy.author: Rumi

purpose.text: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
purpose.author: Benjamin Disraeli

purpose.text: Good luck is another name for tenacity of purpose.
purpose.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

purpose.text: To want to be what one can be is purpose in life.
purpose.author: Cynthia Ozick

purpose.text: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
purpose.author: Kahlil Gibran

purpose.text: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.
purpose.author: Woodrow Wilson

purpose.text: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.
purpose.author: Mortimer J. Adler

purpose.text: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
purpose.author: Wayne Dyer

purpose.text: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
purpose.author: Napoleon Hill

purpose.text: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
purpose.author: John F. Kennedy

purpose.text: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life.
purpose.author: Anaïs Nin

purpose.text: Meaning is not what you start with but what you end up with.
purpose.author: Peter Elbow

purpose.text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
purpose.author: Richard Bach

purpose.text: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?
purpose.author: Woody Allen

purpose.text: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
purpose.author: Carl Jung

purpose.text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
purpose.author: Muhammad Ali

purpose.text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
purpose.author: Albert Camus

purpose.text: One needs something to believe in, something for which one can have whole-hearted enthusiasm. One needs to feel that one's life has meaning, that one is needed in this world.
purpose.author: Hannah Szenes

justice.text: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
justice.author: Aristotle

justice.text: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
justice.author: Plato

justice.text: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
justice.author: Abraham Lincoln

justice.text: Imagination disposes of everything; it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
justice.author: Blaise Pascal

justice.text: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
justice.author: Winston Churchill

justice.text: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
justice.author: Afrika Bambaataa

justice.text: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.
justice.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

justice.text: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
justice.author: George Orwell

justice.text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
justice.author: Laozi

justice.text: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
justice.author: Criss Jami

justice.text: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.
justice.author: Ayn Rand

justice.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
justice.author: Henry Ford

justice.text: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.
justice.author: Barack Obama

harmony.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the world.
harmony.author: Marcus Aurelius

harmony.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
harmony.author: Marcus Aurelius

harmony.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
harmony.author: Mahatma Gandhi

harmony.text: Peace begins with a smile.
harmony.author: Mother Teresa

harmony.text: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
harmony.author: The Buddha

harmony.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
harmony.author: The Buddha

harmony.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
harmony.author: The Buddha

harmony.text: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.
harmony.author: Christie Brinkley

harmony.text: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding.
harmony.author: Albert Einstein

harmony.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
harmony.author: Melody Beattie

harmony.text: Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, upon hearing which one attains peace.
harmony.author: The Buddha

harmony.text: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
harmony.author: Francis of Assisi

harmony.text: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
harmony.author: Doris Mortman

harmony.text: I took a speed-reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
harmony.author: Woody Allen

harmony.text: Until you make peace with who you are, you will never be content with what you have.
harmony.author: Doris Mortman

harmony.text: If we have a positive mental attitude, then even when surrounded by hostility, we shall not lack inner peace.
harmony.author: Dalai Lama

harmony.text: Consider that not only do negative thoughts and emotions destroy our experience of peace, but they also undermine our health.
harmony.author: Dalai Lama

harmony.text: Peace is not something you wish for. It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
harmony.author: Robert Fulghum

harmony.text: Do not scorn what you have received, nor envy the gains of others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
harmony.author: The Buddha

harmony.text: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.
harmony.author: Dalai Lama

harmony.text: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
harmony.author: Afrika Bambaataa

harmony.text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
harmony.author: Mother Teresa

harmony.text: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
harmony.author: Martin Luther

knowledge.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
knowledge.author: Albert Einstein

knowledge.text: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
knowledge.author: Thomas Edison

knowledge.text: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
knowledge.author: Albert Einstein

knowledge.text: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
knowledge.author: Kahlil Gibran

knowledge.text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
knowledge.author: Jimi Hendrix

knowledge.text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
knowledge.author: Vernon Cooper

knowledge.text: Knowledge is going to make you stronger. Knowledge is going to let you control your life. Knowledge is going to give you the wisdom to teach their children. Knowledge is the thing that makes you smile in the face of disaster.
knowledge.author: Avery Brooks

knowledge.text: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
knowledge.author: Sidney Hook

knowledge.text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
knowledge.author: Immanuel Kant

knowledge.text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
knowledge.author: Lord Byron

knowledge.text: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
knowledge.author: Leonardo da Vinci

knowledge.text: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
knowledge.author: Isocrates

knowledge.text: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
knowledge.author: Carl Jung

knowledge.text: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
knowledge.author: Bernard Shaw

knowledge.text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
knowledge.author: John F. Kennedy

knowledge.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
knowledge.author: Albert Einstein

knowledge.text: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
knowledge.author: George Eliot

knowledge.text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
knowledge.author: Margaret Fuller

knowledge.text: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
knowledge.author: Plato

knowledge.text: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
knowledge.author: Will Durant

knowledge.text: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
knowledge.author: Plato

knowledge.text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
knowledge.author: Anton Chekhov

knowledge.text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
knowledge.author: Laurence J. Peter

knowledge.text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
knowledge.author: Marilyn vos Savant

knowledge.text: The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
knowledge.author: Frank Herbert

knowledge.text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
knowledge.author: Henry David Thoreau

knowledge.text: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
knowledge.author: Benjamin Franklin

knowledge.text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
knowledge.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

knowledge.text: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
knowledge.author: Thomas J. Watson

knowledge.text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
knowledge.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

knowledge.text: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
knowledge.author: William Cowper

knowledge.text: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
knowledge.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

knowledge.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
knowledge.author: Isaac Asimov

knowledge.text: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
knowledge.author: Anaïs Nin

knowledge.text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
knowledge.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

knowledge.text: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
knowledge.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

knowledge.text: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
knowledge.author: Brian O'Driscoll

knowledge.text: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
knowledge.author: Kahlil Gibran

knowledge.text: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.
knowledge.author: Immanuel Kant

knowledge.text: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
knowledge.author: Charles Spurgeon

knowledge.text: Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
knowledge.author: Plato

knowledge.text: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
knowledge.author: Janet Jackson

knowledge.text: Knowledge has three degrees: opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
knowledge.author: Plotinus

knowledge.text: Life a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of the future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
knowledge.author: Charles Lindbergh

knowledge.text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
knowledge.author: Audrey Hepburn

knowledge.text: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
knowledge.author: Napoleon Hill

knowledge.text: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
knowledge.author: Rachel Carson

knowledge.text: I think that we have a great opportunity to impart our wisdom and our knowledge and our experience to this younger generation. It may be different times, but experience transcends time, and wisdom transcends time.
knowledge.author: Victoria Osteen

knowledge.text: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
knowledge.author: Masayoshi Son

knowledge.text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
knowledge.author: Calvin Coolidge

knowledge.text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
knowledge.author: Confucius

knowledge.text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
knowledge.author: Jim Rohn

knowledge.text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
knowledge.author: Leonardo da Vinci

knowledge.text: Learning is finding out what you already know.
knowledge.author: Richard Bach

knowledge.text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
knowledge.author: Josh Billings

knowledge.text: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
knowledge.author: Yogi Berra

knowledge.text: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
knowledge.author: Joseph Joubert

knowledge.text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
knowledge.author: Louisa May Alcott

knowledge.text: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
knowledge.author: Confucius

knowledge.text: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
knowledge.author: Jack Welch

knowledge.text: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
knowledge.author: Colin Powell

knowledge.text: We come to love not by finding a perfect person, but by learning to see an imperfect person perfectly.
knowledge.author: Sam Keen

knowledge.text: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.
knowledge.author: Mortimer J. Adler

knowledge.text: To have much learning and skill, to be well-trained in discipline, and good in speech — this is the highest blessing.
knowledge.author: The Buddha

knowledge.text: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
knowledge.author: Marcia Fudge

hope.text: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
hope.author: Christopher Reeve

hope.text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
hope.author: Albert Einstein

hope.text: Hope arouses, as nothing else can arouse, a passion for the possible.
hope.author: William Sloane Coffin

hope.text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
hope.author: Alexandre Dumas

hope.text: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
hope.author: Abraham Lincoln

hope.text: Creativity comes from trust. Trust your instincts. And never hope more than you work.
hope.author: Rita Mae Brown

hope.text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
hope.author: Helen Keller

hope.text: The grand essentials of happiness are: something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
hope.author: Alexander Chalmers

hope.text: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.
hope.author: Niels Bohr

hope.text: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
hope.author: Dalai Lama

hope.text: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
hope.author: Winston Churchill

hope.text: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.
hope.author: Thomas Edison

hope.text: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
hope.author: Thomas Jefferson

hope.text: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one, I hope someday you will join us, and the world will live as one.
hope.author: John Lennon

hope.text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
hope.author: Dale Carnegie

hope.text: You cannot change anything in your life with intention alone, which can become a watered-down, occasional hope that you'll get to tomorrow. Intention without action is useless.
hope.author: Caroline Myss

hope.text: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it.
hope.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

hope.text: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.
hope.author: Thomas Jefferson

hope.text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
hope.author: Woodrow Wilson

hope.text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
hope.author: Colin Powell

anger.text: Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.
anger.author: The Buddha

anger.text: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
anger.author: Seneca the Younger

anger.text: More often than not, anger is actually an indication of weakness rather than of strength.
anger.author: Dalai Lama

anger.text: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
anger.author: Epictetus

fear.text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but simply moving on with dignity despite that fear.
fear.author: Pat Riley

fear.text: Pitching is the art of instilling fear.
fear.author: Sandy Koufax

fear.text: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
fear.author: Bertrand Russell

fear.text: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
fear.author: Shirley MacLaine

fear.text: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
fear.author: Sammy Davis Jr.

fear.text: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
fear.author: Richard Bach

fear.text: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
fear.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

fear.text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
fear.author: Francis of Assisi

fear.text: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
fear.author: The Buddha

fear.text: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
fear.author: Nelson Mandela

fear.text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
fear.author: Richard Bach

fear.text: Fear grows in darkness; if you think there's a bogeyman around, turn on the light.
fear.author: Dorothy Thompson

fear.text: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
fear.author: Léon Blum

fear.text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
fear.author: The Buddha

fear.text: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
fear.author: The Buddha

fear.text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
fear.author: Confucius

fear.text: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
fear.author: Jane Addams

fear.text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
fear.author: Marie Curie

fear.text: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
fear.author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

fear.text: In romance, we feel the need to zoom in and expound on our partner's foibles in intimate detail; in friendship, we tend to do the opposite, avoiding confrontation through fear, lethargy or both.
fear.author: Mariella Frostrup

fear.text: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
fear.author: Alan Watts

fear.text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
fear.author: Walter Inglis Anderson

fear.text: Fear is your worst enemy. Risk is your best friend.
fear.author: Gurbaksh Chahal

fear.text: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
fear.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

fear.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
fear.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

fear.text: A fear of weakness only strengthens weakness.
fear.author: Criss Jami

fear.text: What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.
fear.author: Spencer Johnson

general.text: All I can say about life is, Oh God, enjoy it!
general.author: Bob Newhart

general.text: The thoughts we choose to think are the tools we use to paint the canvas of our lives.
general.author: Louise Hay

general.text: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
general.author: William Lyon Phelps

general.text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
general.author: Margaret Cousins

general.text: Some do not understand that we must die, But those who do realize this settle their quarrels.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

general.text: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
general.author: Jimmy Dean

general.text: Life is just a chance to grow a soul.
general.author: A. Powell Davies

general.text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events, not of words. Trust movement.
general.author: Alfred Adler

general.text: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: By living deeply in the present moment we can understand the past better and we can prepare for a better future.
general.author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

general.text: If A is success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
general.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

general.text: We need to find the courage to say NO to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
general.author: Barbara De Angelis

general.text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.
general.author: Alfred Korzybski

general.text: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
general.author: Jim Rohn

general.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
general.author: Amelia Earhart

general.text: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
general.author: Kahlil Gibran

general.text: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
general.author: Carl Jung

general.text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: Feeling and longing are the motive forces behind all human endeavor and human creations.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: There is no duty we so underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world.
general.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

general.text: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: Sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
general.author: William C. Menninger

general.text: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
general.author: A. A. Milne

general.text: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
general.author: Corita Kent

general.text: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
general.author: Christopher Morley

general.text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
general.author: Albert Camus

general.text: As you think, so shall you become.
general.author: Bruce Lee

general.text: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
general.author: Alan Watts

general.text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
general.author: Bernard Shaw

general.text: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
general.author: William Blake

general.text: Life is about timing.
general.author: Carl Lewis

general.text: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.text: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
general.author: Bruce Lee

general.text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.text: The person who lives life fully, glowing with life's energy, is the person who lives a successful life.
general.author: Daisaku Ikeda

general.text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
general.author: George Bernard Shaw

general.text: Where there is love there is life.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: I think that novels that leave out technology misrepresent life as badly as Victorians misrepresented life by leaving out sex.
general.author: Kurt Vonnegut

general.text: Life is a progress, and not a station.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
general.author: Euripides

general.text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
general.author: Immanuel Kant

general.text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
general.author: Simone de Beauvoir

general.text: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.
general.author: Woody Allen

general.text: Life is a learning experience, only if you learn.
general.author: Yogi Berra

general.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
general.author: Anaïs Nin

general.text: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
general.author: John Lennon

general.text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
general.author: Baltasar Gracián

general.text: To enjoy life, we must touch much of it lightly.
general.author: Voltaire

general.text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
general.author: Aristotle

general.text: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
general.author: Victor Hugo

general.text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
general.author: Baltasar Gracián

general.text: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.text: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.
general.author: Tom Hodgkinson

general.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
general.author: Anaïs Nin

general.text: Life is movement-we breathe, we eat, we walk, we move!
general.author: John Pierrakos

general.text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
general.author: Kahlil Gibran

general.text: To change one's life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.
general.author: William James

general.text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
general.author: Thomas Jefferson

general.text: To want to be what one can be is purpose in life.
general.author: Cynthia Ozick

general.text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
general.author: John Lennon

general.text: The exercise of an extraordinary gift is the supremist pleasure in life.
general.author: Mark Twain

general.text: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
general.author: George Sand

general.text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
general.author: Hubert Humphrey

general.text: The universe is transformation; our life is what our thoughts make it.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.text: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
general.author: Laurence J. Peter

general.text: Love and compassion open our own inner life, reducing stress, distrust and loneliness.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.text: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
general.author: Gail Sheehy

general.text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
general.author: Simone de Beauvoir

general.text: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.
general.author: Thomas Edison

general.text: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
general.author: Marie Curie

general.text: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
general.author: Henry Ward Beecher

general.text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
general.author: Epicurus

general.text: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.
general.author: Aesop

general.text: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
general.author: Aristotle

general.text: Step with care and great tact and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
general.author: Dr. Seuss

general.text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
general.author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

general.text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
general.author: Rumi

general.text: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
general.author: Og Mandino

general.text: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
general.author: Winifred Holtby

general.text: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
general.author: Masayoshi Son

general.text: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
general.author: Francis Bacon

general.text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
general.author: Rollo May

general.text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
general.author: Thomas Edison

general.text: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
general.author: Lewis Carroll

general.text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
general.author: Bodhidharma

general.text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
general.author: Socrates

general.text: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
general.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

general.text: When in doubt, don't.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.text: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
general.author: Bill Bradley

general.text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
general.author: Alexandre Dumas

general.text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
general.author: Ben Hogan

general.text: To lead people walk behind them.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world…
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: A single lamp may light hundreds of thousands of lamps without itself being diminished.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
general.author: Sammy Davis Jr.

general.text: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
general.author: John Burroughs

general.text: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
general.author: Plato

general.text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: When you see a man of worth, think of how you may emulate him. When you see one who is unworthy, examine yourself.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
general.author: Henry David Thoreau

general.text: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
general.author: Napoleon

general.text: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
general.author: Samuel Johnson

general.text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.text: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
general.author: Michel de Montaigne

general.text: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
general.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

general.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
general.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

general.text: He who can curb his wrath as soon as it arises, as a timely antidote will check snake's venom that so quickly spreads, — such a monk gives up the here and the beyond, just as a serpent sheds its worn-out skin.

general.text: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.
general.author: Yoko Ono

general.text: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
general.author: Barack Obama

general.text: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
general.author: Lucille Ball

general.text: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.

general.text: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!
general.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

general.text: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
general.author: Charles Dickens

general.text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
general.author: Euripides

general.text: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
general.author: Walter Lippmann

general.text: With age comes wisdom and a high sex drive. And the wisdom to enjoy it.
general.author: Amber Valletta

general.text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
general.author: Jimi Hendrix

general.text: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
general.author: Aeschylus

general.text: Wisdom begins at the end.
general.author: Daniel Webster

general.text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
general.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

general.text: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
general.author: Francis of Assisi

general.text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
general.author: Vernon Cooper

general.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
general.author: Augustine of Hippo

general.text: Wisdom is found only in truth.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

general.text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
general.author: Baltasar Gracián

general.text: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
general.author: Sophocles

general.text: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
general.author: Norman Cousins

general.text: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
general.author: Sophocles

general.text: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
general.author: Phil Jackson

general.text: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
general.author: Sophocles

general.text: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
general.author: P. Chidambaram

general.text: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
general.author: Christopher Reeve

general.text: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
general.author: Sophocles

general.text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
general.author: Napoleon

general.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
general.author: Francis Bacon

general.text: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
general.author: William Saroyan

general.text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
general.author: Euripides

general.text: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
general.author: Lauren Bacall

general.text: All things change; nothing perishes.
general.author: Ovid

general.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
general.author: Aldous Huxley

general.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.text: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
general.author: Maria Montessori

general.text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
general.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

general.text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
general.author: Bernard Shaw

general.text: Should someone do good, let them do it again and again. They should develop this habit, for the accumulation of goodness brings joy.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
general.author: Samuel Johnson

general.text: Commitment is an act, not a word.
general.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

general.text: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
general.author: Cicero

general.text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
general.author: Will Rogers

general.text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
general.author: Charlotte Brontë

general.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, we must be busy when the corn is ripe.
general.author: Torquato Tasso

general.text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
general.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

general.text: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
general.author: Molière

general.text: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
general.author: Anton Chekhov

general.text: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: From wonder into wonder existence opens.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Better it is to live one day seeing the rise and fall of things than to live a hundred years without ever seeing the rise and fall of things.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
general.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

general.text: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
general.author: Anatole France

general.text: To be wrong is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
general.author: Plutarch

general.text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise.
general.author: Barack Obama

general.text: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
general.author: Joseph Prince

general.text: Whatever has the nature of arising has the nature of ceasing.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: To give oneself earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
general.author: Lord Byron

general.text: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
general.author: Seneca the Younger

general.text: All phenomena are preceded by the mind, created by the mind, and have the mind as their master.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
general.author: Aesop

general.text: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.
general.author: Plato

general.text: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
general.author: Franz Grillparzer

general.text: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
general.author: Franz Kafka

general.text: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
general.author: John Burroughs

general.text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
general.author: Francis of Assisi

general.text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
general.author: William Blake

general.text: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: We must learn our limits. We are all something, but none of us are everything.
general.author: Blaise Pascal

general.text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
general.author: Sigmund Freud

general.text: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
general.author: Pope Paul VI

general.text: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: The cautious seldom err.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
general.author: Kahlil Gibran

general.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across — unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Silence is a source of great strength.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
general.author: Aristotle

general.text: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
general.author: Swami Vivekananda

general.text: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.
general.author: Henry David Thoreau

general.text: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
general.author: M. Scott Peck

general.text: 'All conditioned things are impermanent' — when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: Whoever doesn't flare up at someone who's angry wins a battle hard to win.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
general.author: John Muir

general.text: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
general.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

general.text: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
general.author: William Wordsworth

general.text: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
general.author: Plato

general.text: Do I speak at the right time, or not? Do I speak of facts, or not? Do I speak gently or harshly? Do I speak profitable words or not? Do I speak with a kindly heart, or inwardly malicious?
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: We are wiser than we know.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: By oneself is evil done; by oneself is one defiled. By oneself is evil left undone; by oneself is one made pure.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
general.author: Epictetus

general.text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents, which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant.
general.author: Horace

general.text: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
general.author: Elbert Hubbard

general.text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: Being in humaneness is good. If we select other goodness and thus are far apart from humaneness, how can we be the wise?
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Honesty is the best policy.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.text: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
general.author: Walter Benjamin

general.text: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
general.author: Dale Turner

general.text: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
general.author: Francis Bacon

general.text: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
general.author: Diogenes

general.text: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
general.author: Thomas Jefferson

general.text: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
general.author: Charles Spurgeon

general.text: Never find fault with the absent.
general.author: Alexander Pope

general.text: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
general.author: Isaac D'Israeli

general.text: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
general.author: Harvey Mackay

general.text: It's easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.
general.author: Leonardo da Vinci

general.text: Much though he recites the sacred texts, but acts not accordingly, that heedless man is like a cowherd who only counts the cows of others
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: You cannot change anything in your life with intention alone, which can become a watered-down, occasional hope that you'll get to tomorrow. Intention without action is useless.
general.author: Caroline Myss

general.text: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: No man was ever wise by chance.
general.author: Seneca the Younger

general.text: None knows the weight of another's burden.
general.author: George Herbert

general.text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
general.author: Jim Rohn

general.text: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Between saying and doing, many a pair of shoes is worn out.
general.author: Iris Murdoch

general.text: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
general.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

general.text: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
general.author: Sam Walton

general.text: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Both formerly and now, it is only suffering that I describe, and the cessation of suffering.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
general.author: Sophocles

general.text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
general.author: Janet Jackson

general.text: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.
general.author: Benjamin Franklin

general.text: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
general.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

general.text: Each day provides its own gifts.
general.author: Marcus Aurelius

general.text: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
general.author: Edmund Burke

general.text: Knowledge is going to make you stronger. Knowledge is going to let you control your life. Knowledge is going to give you the wisdom to teach their children. Knowledge is the thing that makes you smile in the face of disaster.
general.author: Avery Brooks

general.text: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
general.author: Thomas Hobbes

general.text: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.text: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
general.author: Winston Churchill

general.text: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
general.author: John Wooden

general.text: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens.
general.author: Ellen Glasgow

general.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
general.author: Henry Ford

general.text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
general.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

general.text: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
general.author: Will Rogers

general.text: Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Be the chief but never the lord.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
general.author: Rabbi Hillel

general.text: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Know from the rivers in clefts and in crevices: those in small channels flow noisily, the great flow silent. Whatever's not full makes noise. Whatever is full is quiet.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
general.author: Marilyn vos Savant

general.text: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
general.author: G. K. Chesterton

general.text: One is not called noble who harms living beings. By not harming living beings one is called noble.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
general.author: Henry David Thoreau

general.text: In action a great heart is the chief qualification. In work, a great head.
general.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

general.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
general.author: Isocrates

general.text: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
general.author: John F. Kennedy

general.text: Should you find a wise critic to point out your faults, follow him as you would a guide to hidden treasure.

general.text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.

general.text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
general.author: Wayne Dyer

general.text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
general.author: Elizabeth Kenny

general.text: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
general.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

general.text: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
general.author: W. Clement Stone

general.text: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
general.author: Harriet Woods

general.text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
general.author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

general.text: You really can change the world if you care enough.
general.author: Marian Wright Edelman

general.text: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
general.author: Thomas Paine

general.text: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
general.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

general.text: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.

general.text: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.

general.text: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.

general.text: The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.

general.text: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.

general.text: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.

general.text: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.

general.text: The more you know yourself, the more you forgive yourself.

general.text: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
general.author: Bertrand Russell

general.text: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.

general.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
general.author: Isaac Asimov

general.text: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
general.author: Bernard Shaw

general.text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.

general.text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.

general.text: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
general.author: Anton Chekhov

general.text: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
general.author: William Cowper

general.text: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
general.author: Pablo Picasso

general.text: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: He who is contented is rich.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
general.author: Unknown

general.text: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
general.author: Gurbaksh Chahal

general.text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
general.author: Carol Burnett

general.text: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.
general.author: Earl Nightingale

general.text: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
general.author: Anne Wilson Schaef

general.text: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.

general.text: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.

general.text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.

general.text: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
general.author: Richard Whately

general.text: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
general.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

general.text: Leave no stone unturned.
general.author: Euripides

general.text: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.

general.text: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
general.author: Thomas Jefferson

general.text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: He who knows himself is enlightened.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.

general.text: Do not scorn what you have received, nor envy the gains of others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.

general.text: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.

general.text: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
general.author: John F. Kennedy

general.text: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
general.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

general.text: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
general.author: George S. Patton

general.text: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or airplane or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
general.author: John Burroughs

general.text: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
general.author: Mahatma Gandhi

general.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.

general.text: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
general.author: Jim Elliot

general.text: Forgiveness is choosing to love. It is the first skill of self-giving love.

general.text: One should not hurt others if one loves oneself.

general.text: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

general.text: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.

general.text: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.

general.text: The thing that is disliked by me is also disliked by others. Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?
