general.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
general.author: Samuel Johnson

general.text: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
general.author: John D. Rockefeller

general.text: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.
general.author: Sydney Smith

general.text: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.
general.author: Nelson Mandela

general.text: If you don't program yourself, life will program you.
general.author: Les Brown

general.text: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
general.author: Steve Maraboli

general.text: Life is either a daring adventure, or it is nothing.
general.author: Helen Keller

general.text: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.
general.author: Ayn Rand

general.text: This is such a short and precious life that it's really important that you don't spend it being unhappy.
general.author: Naval Ravikant

general.text: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
general.author: John Wooden

general.text: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to deceive!
general.author: Walter Scott

general.text: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
general.author: Thomas Edison

general.text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
general.author: Confucius

general.text: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.
general.author: Ravi Zacharias

general.text: Once you label me you negate me.
general.author: Søren Kierkegaard

general.text: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
general.author: Theodore Roosevelt

general.text: Democracy's premise rests on the notion that the collective wisdom of the majority will prove right more often than it's wrong; that given sufficient opportunity in the pursuit of happiness, your population will develop its talents, its intellect, its better judgment; that over time its capacity for discernment and self-correction will be enlarged.
general.author: Ben Fountain

general.text: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
general.author: Norman Douglas

general.text: If the shoe doesn't fit, must we change the foot?
general.author: Gloria Steinem

general.text: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
general.author: Aesop

general.text: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
general.author: Plato

general.text: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
general.author: Julie Morgenstern

general.text: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
general.author: Morihei Ueshiba

general.text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
general.author: Audrey Hepburn

general.text: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
general.author: Amelia Earhart

general.text: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
general.author: Michael Jordan

general.text: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
general.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

general.text: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
general.author: Aeschylus

general.text: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
general.author: Frank Abagnale

general.text: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
general.author: John F. Kennedy

general.text: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.text: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
general.author: Leonard Nimoy

general.text: As a water bead on a lotus leaf, as water on a red lily, does not adhere, so the sage does not adhere to the seen, the heard, or the sensed.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
general.author: William C. Menninger

general.text: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
general.author: J. M. Barrie

general.text: The calmed say that what is well-spoken is best; second, that one should say what is right, not unrighteous; third, what's pleasing, not displeasing; fourth, what is true, not false.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: In the sky there are no tracks. Outside there is no recluse. There are no conditioned things that are eternal. There is no instability in the Buddhas.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
general.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

general.text: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
general.author: Margaret Thatcher

general.text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
general.author: Calvin Coolidge

general.text: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
general.author: Plutarch

general.text: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Should a seeker not find a companion who is better or equal, let them resolutely pursue a solitary course.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
general.author: Laozi

general.text: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: When you meet someone better than yourself, turn your thoughts to becoming his equal. When you meet someone not as good as you are, look within and examine your own self.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
general.author: George Santayana

general.text: Even youngish men can acquire wisdom as time goes by.
general.author: John Bercow

general.text: It is in the nature of things that joy arises in a person free from remorse.
general.author: The Buddha

general.text: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
general.author: John Keats

general.text: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
general.author: Peter Abelard
